intro: Lysimachia waikoluensis, commonly known as the Waikolu enigma, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Kauai. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts. Its unique floral structure and genetic distinctiveness make it an important species for botanical research.
